item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, November 29, 2024 at 1:25 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Send someone you appreciate an official 'Continue and Persist' Letter (985 points | 171 comments)
2. Borgo Programming Language (92 points | 27 comments)
3. Engineers do not get to make startup mistakes when they build ledgers (235 points | 226 comments)

8. Finland, Sweden complete repairs on Baltic Sea cables (17 points | 7 comments)
9. The success and failure of Ninja (2020) (222 points | 49 comments)

14. William James and the philosophy of pragmatism (2018) (69 points | 15 comments)

18. Show HN: Indentation-based syntax for Clojure (49 points | 19 comments)
19. I taught rats to drive a car, and it may help us lead happier lives (4 points | 1 comment)
20. A new start after 60: I became a 'hummingbird' for people with dementia (125 points | 29 comments)
21. This G15 is the Oldest Running Digital Computer in America [video] (52 points | 6 comments)
22. Float Self-Tagging (64 points | 43 comments)
23. Mechanical Engineer creates instruments for his one man industrial metal band (43 points | 14 comments)
24. An Intuitive Explanation of Sparse Autoencoders for LLM Interpretability (55 points | 1 comment)
25. The great abandonment: what happens to the natural world when people disappear? (88 points | 94 comments)
26. Spotify has shut down several API endpoints (228 points | 197 comments)
27. Hetzner cuts traffic on US VPSs, raises prices (362 points | 599 comments)
28. Gimp 3.0 – a milestone for open-source image editing (128 points | 56 comments)
29. In the Rockets' Red Glare: The past and future of hot-rodding in America (51 points | 50 comments)
